meanings.definition: A humorous or satirical imitation of a serious piece of literature or writing.
meanings.sent1: The comedy show featured hilarious parodies of famous novels.
meanings.sent2: The students performed a parody of Shakespeare's play for the school talent show.
meanings.sent3: The clever parody of the classic novel had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her parody of the famous author's writing style was spot-on.
meanings.sent5: The parody of the historical event made it easier to understand and remember.

meanings.definition: To produce a humorous imitation of (a writer, artist, or genre).
meanings.sent1: She parodies popular songs by changing the lyrics to make them funny.
meanings.sent2: The comedian loves to parody famous actors in his sketches.
meanings.sent3: The movie parodies the superhero genre in a clever way.
meanings.sent4: His artwork parodies the famous painter's style with a humorous twist.
meanings.sent5: The show parodies current events to bring humor to the audience.
